intro: Acmispon americanus, commonly known as the American burr medic, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Acmispon americanus is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
